dashboard-process-template:
<template name="PID-Master:!*!: Project (Team)" ID="PID/MasterRoot" defineRollup="no" dataFile="PID/master_root_dataFile.txt" constraints="{PID/Rollup}" > This node cannot be directly instantiated by the user. (The 'required parent' list of } enforces this policy.) They must instead instantiate a team project stub, and run the setup wizard to create an instance of this template.
We also change the 'allowed children' list to {PID/Rollup. This allows the user to create rollups under this node, but prevents them from adding any other type of children. Those children must instead be added using the WBS editor.
<html ID="sum" href=""/>
We alter the constraints to make this node immovable and uneditable. We also change the 'required parent' list to '}', which makes it impossible for users to instantiate this node into their hierarchy manually.
<html ID="sump" href="PID/rollup_plan_summary.shtm" title=" Rollup Project Plan Summary"/> <html ID="sumq" href="PID/rollup_quality_summary.shtm" title=" Rollup Project Quality Summary"/> <html ID="charts" href="PID/charts.shtm" title=" Analysis Charts"/>
<template name="PID-Team:!*!: Project (Team)" ID="PID/TeamRoot" defineRollup="no" dataFile="PID/team2_root_dataFile.txt" constraints="{PID/Rollup}" > This node cannot be directly instantiated by the user. (The 'required parent' list of } enforces this policy.) They must instead instantiate a team project stub, and run the setup wizard to create an instance of this template.
We also change the 'allowed children' list to {PID/Rollup. This allows the user to create rollups under this node, but prevents them from adding any other type of children. Those children must instead be added using the WBS editor.
<html ID="sum" href=""/>
We alter the constraints to make this node immovable and uneditable. We also change the 'required parent' list to '}', which makes it impossible for users to instantiate this node into their hierarchy manually.
<html ID="sump" href="PID/rollup_plan_summary.shtm" title=" Rollup Project Plan Summary"/> <html ID="sumq" href="PID/rollup_quality_summary.shtm" title=" Rollup Project Quality Summary"/> <html ID="charts" href="PID/charts.shtm" title=" Analysis Charts"/>
<template name="PID-Team:!*!:Task" ID="PID/TeamTask" defineRollup="no" XdefectLog="false" dataFile="PID/team_task_dataFile.txt" constraints="{PID/TeamTask{PID/Rollup{PID/PHASE/}PID/TeamRoot}PID/TeamNode}PID/TeamTask" >
First, define a few common values that we will use repeatedly below.
creatable_indiv2_nodes is a constraint value, listing the IDs of nodes that the user can create within the boundaries of a team project in their personal dashboard.
parentable_indiv2_nodes is a constraint value, listing the IDs of nodes that can exist within the boundaries of a team project in a personal dashboard, that a user can create children underneath.
{PID/Indiv2Task
}PID/Indiv2Root}PID/Indiv2ReadOnlyNode}PID/Indiv2Task
{PID/PHASE/
<template name="PID-Indiv2:!*!: Project" ID="PID/Indiv2Root" defineRollup="no" dataFile="PID/indiv2_root_dataFile.txt" autoData="none" constraints="}" > This node cannot be directly instantiated by the user. They must instead use the team setup wizard to join a team project.
<html ID="sump" href="cms/PID/indiv_plan_summary" title=" Project Plan Summary"/> <html ID="size" href="PID/sizeForm.class" title=" Size Inventory"/> <html ID="top" href="PID/script.htm" title=" Process Script"/>
<template name="PID-Indiv2:!*!:Subsystem" ID="PID/Indiv2ReadOnlyNode" defineRollup="no" defectLog="true" dataFile="PID/indiv2_empty_dataFile.txt" autoData="none" href="none" constraints="MED}" > We alter the constraints to make this node immovable and uneditable. We also change the 'required parent' list to '}', which makes it impossible for users to instantiate this node into their hierarchy manually.
<template name="PID-Indiv2:!*!:Team Project Task" ID="PID/Indiv2Task" defineRollup="no" defectLog="true" dataFile="PID/indiv2_empty_dataFile.txt" autoData="none" href="none" constraints=" " >
<template name="PID-Indiv2:!*!:PROBE Task" ID="PID/Indiv2PROBE" defineRollup="no" defectLog="true" dataFile="PID/indiv2_probe_dataFile.txt" autoData="none" href="none" constraints="D{" >
Define a few common values that we will use repeatedly below. The description above applies here as well, but these values are used to build the historical individual templates.
In addition, the creatable_indiv_nodes item lists all of the process phase templates. Strictly speaking, the user can no longer add those process phase templates to their hierarchy (because the phase templates use the "required parent" constraint to forbid their instantiation). But it is important to list them anyway, because the hierarchy editor uses their presence in this list to constrain the set of allowable child names.
{PID/PHASE/ {PID/IndivTask/ {PID/IndivEmptyNode{PID/Rollup
}PID/IndivTask/ }PID/IndivRoot}PID/IndivReadOnlyNode }PID/IndivFullNode}PID/IndivEmptyNode
<template name="PID-Indiv:!*!: Project" ID="PID/IndivRoot" defineRollup="no" defectLog="true" dataFile="PID/indiv_root_dataFile.txt" constraints="}" > This node cannot be directly instantiated by the user. They must instead use the team setup wizard to join a team project.
<html ID="sump" href="PID/plan_summary.shtm" title=" Project Plan Summary"/> <html ID="size" href="PID/sizeForm.class" title=" Size Inventory"/> <html ID="top" href="PID/script.htm" title=" Process Script"/>
<template name="PID-Indiv:!*!:Subtask" ID="PID/IndivFullNode"
usesRollup="PID"
defineRollup="no"
defectLog="true" dataFile="PID/indiv_full_dataFile.txt" size="New & Changed LOC" href="none" constraints="}" > In production use, this template is virtually never used, and just causes confusion for users. Therefore, I'm changing the 'required parent' list to '}', so users won't see this template as an option. (I don't delete the template itself for legacy purposes.)
